questions.question_text: An administrator observes that the port1 interface cannot be configured with an IP address. What can be the reasons for that? (Choose three.)

choices.D: The interface is a member of a zone.
choices.A: The interface has been configured for one-arm sniffer.
choices.E: Captive portal is enabled in the interface.
choices.B: The interface is a member of a virtual wire pair.

discussion.content: C should be the right answer here. Please check and update

choices.C: The name of the applied web filter profile is default.
choices.B: The usage quota for the IP address 10.0.1.10 has expired.
choices.D: The web site miniclip.com matches a static URL filter whose action is set to Warning.
choices.A: The action for the category Games is set to block.

choices.B: FortiGate routed the packet through port3.
choices.D: The source IP address of the packet was translated to 10.0.1.10.
choices.A: The packet was allowed by the firewall policy with the ID 00007fc0.
choices.C: FortiGate received a TCP SYN/ACK packet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Source IP wasn’t translated, destination was translated
flag on the packet was S, which is a Sync packet

choices.A: Only individual usersג€"not groupsג€"defined in the captive portal configuration.
choices.D: Users and groups defined in the firewall policy.
choices.B: Groups defined in the captive portal configuration

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Source will be the SSL VPN interface

comments.content: You must be right. I took the internal Fortinet test, chose port 2 and it's one of the few questions I got wrong

questions.question_text: An administrator needs to create a tunnel mode SSLVPN to access an internal web server from the Internet. The web server is connected to port1. The Internet is connected to port2. Both interfaces belong to the VDOM named Corporation. What interface must be used as the source for the firewall policy that will allow this traffic?
